Strings: In your Dialog class, you can override the [color=Gold]OnHash()[/color] method.
It gets triggered when your script encounters a hash tag like [color=Gold]\[#MyTag\][/color].
You can assign a corresponding value as well, and add many to one block as long as they're separated by white space. [color=Gold]\[#MyTag #Another=4\][/color]
All hash tags in a block are fed to the virtual method in a [color=Gold]Dictionary<string, string>[/color].
In the example [color=Gold]Dialog.cs[/color], we handle an "OptionColumns" tag.
Since our example option box is a GridContainer, we use it to set the Columns property.
We just used [color=Gold]\[#OptionColumns=3\][/color] to set the number of columns to three.
Just now we set them to two!
Feel free to try your own!
